message.entry: The first argument of the service client constructor uses the wrong type, {0}. Use a ros.Node object as the first argument. For more information, see the ros.ServiceClient help topic.
Unable to create a {0} service client.
The requested service type, {0}, does not equal the expected type, {1}. Restart the node that this service client belongs to.
The {0} service with service type {1} is already registered on the ROS master. Creating it with type {2}, not {3}.
An error occurred while creating a service request message of type {0}.
Unable to call the service with message type {1}, as it expects a message of type {0}. Call the function again with the correct input message.
The {0} service did not become available during {1} seconds. Try a longer timeout.
The service call timed out after waiting {0} seconds for a response. Try a longer timeout.
The service server returned an error: "{0}".

An error occurred while shutting down the service client. The persistent connection to the service server might still be active. To ensure that the connection to the server is severed, shut down the node that this service client is connected to.
